page.title: 08A farm worker in Breamore
page.content: I am eighty-four and I've never known any other home. My wife isn't Breamore-born,though. She's from Hale and that makes her a foreigner.People often ask me what Breamore was like when I was a lad.I always said that it didn't look much different but there were lots more folk out and about, working on the estate and in the village.We didn't have the machines that you have today.People had bigger families ,too.These days, the young folk don't stay in Breamore. I like to work out of doors,unless the weather is bad.The garden is important to the wife and me.We don't buy any vegetables or fruit and the villagers around here say my potatoes are second to none.It's funny to think that growing things could be such a pleasure.I guess you can't change the habits of a lifetime.
